New Records: Keegan is 12/22 from 3 in his past 3 games
Key Match Events: Kings outscored the Celtics 61-42 in the 2nd half
Kings held the Celtics to under 100 points for only the second time this year
DeRozan big, Monk big, Keegan big – Domas huge
Defense – Keon, Keegan toughing it out
Pre-Game Insights: Doug Christie emphasized the importance of strong perimeter defense
The Kings played with confidence the entire game
The team played with grit and fire not warmth and smoke
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Doug Christie said that in the 4th quarter, Keon told him that Carter was playing well, so don’t worry about Keon’s minutes!
The team played with energy and played to their strengths on offense
The Kings won by 17 points and thoroughly outperformed the Celtics in the 4th quarter
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Kings won in every statistical category
The team is now 6-1 since Doug Christie took over
The Kings have a chance to make a deep playoff run
